meanings.definition: Mischooses: to make a wrong choice or decision
meanings.sent1: She often mischooses her outfits in the morning, ending up with mismatched clothes.
meanings.sent2: He mischooses the wrong path and gets lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cat mischooses the toy mouse over the real one, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Like a confused traveler, he mischooses his destination and ends up in a completely different city.
meanings.sent5: The student mischooses the answer on the test, leading to a lower grade than expected.

meanings.definition: Mischooses: the act of choosing incorrectly
meanings.sent1: Her constant mischooses in life have led to many regrets.
meanings.sent2: The mischooses made by the committee resulted in a failed project.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors began with a simple mischooses of the wrong actor for the lead role.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, one mischooses can lead to a checkmate in just a few moves.
meanings.sent5: The mischooses of the jury members caused an innocent person to be wrongly convicted.
